results.title: Mass transit: up, up and away
results.brief_description: Argues that the car is a real hazard in urban societies, as well as being a cause of pollution. Examines various alternative means of mass transportation.

results.title: Mass radiography
results.creator_credit: S.O. Siecki, H.M. Nieter and Seven League Unit
results.brief_description: By means of mobile X-Ray units it is possible to take radiograms of large numbers of people I a relatively short time. These photographs are then examined by expert radiologists, and diagnoses made. In this film, the visit of a mobile X-Ray unit to a British factory is shown. (The film is intended for use by Medical Officers and Health and Welfare Officers when they are planning to send a mobile X-Ray unit to a place not previously visited). Also made for the prevention of tuberculosis. Narrated by Lionel Gamlin.

results.title: Marloo the Red kangaroo
results.brief_description: Looks at the life history of the red kangaroo. Shows details of the birth and care of the young, and includes information on typical adult kangaroos in their natural state, in various parts of Australia. Also discusses the problem of conservation.

results.title: Marlene
results.brief_description: Maximilian Schell has created a fascinating film, amusing and sad, imaginative and courageously put together. He presents Dietrich as a genuine star to a new generation of moviegoers. Included are scenes from “Destry Rides Again”, “Morocco”, “Witness for the Prosecution”, “Judgement at Nuremberg”. Dietrich is difficult, forgetful, egotistical, with a unique presence and an unexpectedly forthright manner.

results.title: Marie
results.creator_credit: Douglas Hardy and Southern Cross Films
results.brief_description: Story of the meeting of an Australian man and a migrant girl called Marie from post war Europe. A commentary is given from the man’s point of view on their conversations with her recollections of life in Europe, her regret at her mother not seeing her life in Australia, and her lack of taking her life for granted. Takes place on Sydney harbour in a sailboat race setting. Uses the race and her growing love for the harbour as a metaphor for Australia’s pro-migration program.

results.title: Marcel Proust: from masterpieces to a master's work
results.creator_credit: Jacques Letellier and C A P A C
results.brief_description: Intended to deepen our appreciation and understanding of Proust’s works by reviewing some of the masterpieces of art and music which inspired him and led him to recognise his vocation as a writer. The effect of the Dreyfus case and the Great War are indicated and the lack of interest in his work during his lifetime.
results.title_for_label: Marcel Proust: from masterpieces to a master’s work

results.title: Map reading
results.brief_description: In this documentary from WW1, a navigator adjusting his route on an existing map, after returning from a raid on Dieppe, provides airial views of coastline and towns.

results.title: Map makers
results.creator_credit: Australia. Army. Directorate of Public Relations

results.title: Maori moods and melodies
results.creator_credit: Robert Steele, Neuline Film Productions and New Zealand. Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: New Zealand, home of the Maori people; steaming geysers, bubbling mud and dense forests; snow-lined mountains and turbulent water falls; the fine art of carving; and dancing.
